On Feb 24, 2005, at 12:26 PM, Yan Ling wrote:
Since you're a researcher, Kristen, you should get a mutt from the pound, and study its behavior to discover its traits. Isn't that more fun than getting a dog from which you'll discover nothing new because you already know all of its 
characteristics?  Just my 2 cents.



In general, I advise adopting from the pound in all cases.

a) It's cheaper than an inbred dog from the breeder.
b) The breeder won't gas the dog if you don't buy it. Let someone else buy the overpriced, inbred, retarded dog.
I also advocate getting adult animals from the pound rather than puppies or kittens. There are again two reasons.
a) Puppies and kittens have no problem getting adopted, because everybody is immediately drawn to puppies and kittens.
b) You don't want to get some cute puppy that grows up into the ugliest dog you have ever seen, do you? Get the adult animal. No nasty surprises.
Puppies are like babies. Babies are cute and fun, but then they grow up. A good portion of them grow up to be ugly, and a good portion of them grow up to be assholes and idiots. Some are both, and that's where Jerry Springer guests come from.
I mean, Carrot Top used to be somebody's baby. Would you want the Carrot Top dog? 

Adopt, and do so defensively.

 -dan




On Thu, 24 Feb 2005 14:23 , Kristen Gurba <kgurba@mindspring.com> sent:


--- Tom Martin tmartin@ncifcrf.gov> wrote:


Ha!  I have a 1999 black Toyota Corolla with 47k.
Living one mile from work for several years really
helped.
Yeah, well.. well.. you just don't get to enjoy the amazing Toyota driving
experience as much! So THERE. And ha-ha, white cars show dirt better than 
black.  Take that.
Yeah the 80 mile day commute isn't helping ... I *did* live 5 miles from work
for a whole year and a half, but then I had to go and get another job. Oh well. That's why I got a Corrola, they get great gas mileage and I know I can out 200k + miles on it without any problem. I really wanted a Prius, but with the long commute, I am not sure how economic it would be, since I'm doing 70-75mph the whole time, and I think the electric engine kicks over to gas over 50mph.. 
(correct me if I'm wrong?)




You should get a mutt!  They're healthier--the whole
hybrid vigor thing.


and Michaele countered:


There are pros and cons to both.  Mutts are not
necessarily healthier.  It depends on the dog and
where you get them.
Ah-ha! And the debate begins.. see, I hear this every day - "Get a mutt", "NO! 
Get a pure bred!"
My first inclination would be towards getting a mutt at the pound, as I like the
idea of saving a dog. But, I do like the idea of having a breeder because then you know what traits the dog will have, and it won't be such a surprise. Plus you know their health history, etc. I've been afraid to go to a pound so far, 
because I know I'll go home with a dog without being really prepared.


As with everything, more research is needed..
